ports Package¶

ports Package¶

The ports package.

Contains more specific types of ports derived from the base Port class.

analog_port Module¶

class roco.derived.ports.analog_port.AnalogInputPort(parent, pin, virtual=False, **kwargs)¶

Bases: roco.derived.ports.virtual_electrical_port.VirtualElectricalPort

An Analog input port.

Attributes:
None

An Analog output port.

Attributes:
None

base_port Module¶

class roco.derived.ports.base_port.InPort(parent, name, **kwargs)¶

Bases: roco.derived.ports.code_port.CodePort

A class representing an input port.

Attributes:
No new attributes.
can_mate(other_port)¶

Returns true if this port can mate with other_port and false otherwise. Overrides inherited implementation

Args:
other_port (Port): the port that is compared to this port to check compatibility.
Returns:
Boolean denoting whether or not the ports are compatible.
class roco.derived.ports.base_port.OutPort(parent, name, **kwargs)¶

Bases: roco.derived.ports.code_port.CodePort

A class representing an output port.

Attributes:
No new attributes.
can_mate(other_port)¶

Returns true if this port can mate with other_port and false otherwise. Overrides inherited implementation

Args:
other_port (Port): the port that is compared to this port to check compatibility.
Returns:
Boolean denoting whether or not the ports are compatible.

bool_port Module¶

InBoolPort and OutBoolPort classes.

This module contains the InBoolPort and OutBoolPort classes.

No new attributes.

roco.derived.ports.calculator.func(x)¶
roco.derived.ports.calculator.integral(start, finish)¶

code_port Module¶

CodePort class.

This module contains the CodePort class as well as the following classes that derive from it: OutPort, InPort, InStringPort, OutStringPort, InIntPort, OutIntPort, InFloatPort, OutFloatPort, InDoublePort, OutDoublePort.

class roco.derived.ports.code_port.CodePort(parent, name, label, dtype=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: roco.api.port.Port

A class representing a code port

can_mate(other_port)¶

Returns true if this port can mate with other_port and false otherwise. Overrides inherited implementation

Args:
other_port (Port): the port that is compared to this port to check compatibility.
Returns:
Boolean denoting whether or not the ports are compatible.
constrain(parent, to_port, **kwargs)¶

Return a set of semantic constraints to be satisfied when connecting to to_port object. Overrides inherited implementation.

Args:
parent (component): parent of to_port //CHECK to_port (port): port that is to be connected to this port.
Returns:
list of semantic constraints
get_label()¶

Returns label

Args:
None
Returns:
String containing the label
mangle(name)¶

Mangles the label parameter

Args:
name (str): name of the port

edge_port Module¶

EdgePort class.

This module contains the EdgePort class.

class roco.derived.ports.edge_port.EdgePort(parent, edge_name)¶

Bases: roco.api.port.Port

A class representing a physical edge that can be connected to.

Attributes:
edge (HyperEdge): holds the edge data that the port is associated with. edge_name (str): the name of the edge in the parent graph
constrain(parent, to_port, **kwargs)¶

Return a set of semantic constraints to be satisfied when connecting to to_port object By default, constrain same-named parameters to be equal

Override this method for better matching

Args:
parent (component): The component to which this port will be added. to_port: The port to be connected to
Returns:
list of semantic constraints
Raises:
AttributeError: The edge with the given name does not have a
length attribute
get_edges()¶

Returns the edge associated with the port

Args:
None
Returns:
List containing names of edges
get_points()¶

Returns the points associated with the edge

Args:
None
Returns:
Edge points
prefix(prefix='')¶

Adds a prefix to the edge name

Args:
prefix (str): The prefix string
update()¶

Updates th edge length parameter

Args:
None
Raises:
AttributeError: The edge with the given name does not have a
length attribute

Bases: roco.derived.ports.six_dof_port.SixDOFPort

A class representing a physical face that can be connected to.

Attributes:

mount_port Module¶

class roco.derived.ports.mount_port.MountPort(parent, decoration)¶

Bases: roco.api.port.Port

A class representing the connection between a physical object and a mechanical face. MountPorts contain decorations, which are cutouts that allow for phycial objects to be placed onto faces

Attributes:
decoration (Decoration): A graph containing the face holes for the mount
can_mate(other_port)¶

Returns true if this port can mate with other_port and false otherwise. Override this method for better matching.

Args:
other_port (Port): the port that is compared to this port to check compatibility.
Returns:
Boolean denoting whether or not the ports are compatible.

toString()¶
